intro: Oldenlandia coronata, commonly known as the crown vine or crown flower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, showy white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, viscid substance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in warmer climates.
